first, it might be rubbish with good pics.
Alan

Sent: Saturday, August 16, 2003 5:42 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: inexpensive book


This book is due to be published in English next April.
Alan

----- Original Message -----
From: "David Zincavage" <jdz@...>
To: <token_kenkyu_kai@...>
Cc: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, August 14, 2003 3:51 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: inexpensive book


: I just received my copy of:
:
: Henryk Socha, Elementy broni samurajskiej - Tsuba [Elements of the Arms
: the Samurai - The Tsuba], Dom Wydawnictwo Bellona, Warsaw, 2003.
:
:
: which I ordered June 18th from
:
: www.merlin.com.pl in Poland.
:
: The book cost 77.50 zlotys. Shipping cost 30. zlotys. Total: 107.50
zlotys.
: The zloty is trading today in the 3.85 to 3.90 to the dollar range.
: That comes out to something like $28, which is heck of a deal a 232 pp,
: quarto, color book. The text is in Polish, of course, but all the
technical
: terms are the Japanese terms everyone is accustomed to. There are 100
very
: nicely full page photographed tsuba, including some very nice examples.
:
: This book site work just like Amazon, but is all in Polish. Search on
: "tsuba," and you'll find the book. It is fairly easy to order. The only
: tricky part is fitting US addresses into spaces designed for
: Polish-formatted addresses.
:
:

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: inexpensive book
messages.msgSnippet: Not a bad  book. I bought it (and his sword book) when I was in Varsavia last June. I also got into teh back room of teh National Museum and looked at maybe
messages.messageBody:
Not a bad book. I bought it (and his sword book) when I was in Varsavia
last June. I also got into teh back room of teh National Museum and looked
at maybe 200 tsuba they have. Oh and 2 swords. Bob Elder


Thanks!

Bob
East Coast Martial Art Supplies
www.ecmas.com

messages.subject: Re: inexpensive book
messages.msgSnippet: I just received my copy of: Henryk Socha, Elementy broni samurajskiej - Tsuba [Elements of the Arms of the Samurai - The Tsuba], Dom Wydawnictwo Bellona,
messages.messageBody:
I just received my copy of:

Henryk Socha, Elementy broni samurajskiej - Tsuba [Elements of the Arms of
the Samurai - The Tsuba], Dom Wydawnictwo Bellona, Warsaw, 2003.


which I ordered June 18th from

www.merlin.com.pl in Poland.

The book cost 77.50 zlotys. Shipping cost 30. zlotys. Total: 107.50 zlotys.
The zloty is trading today in the 3.85 to 3.90 to the dollar range.
That comes out to something like $28, which is heck of a deal a 232 pp,
quarto, color book. The text is in Polish, of course, but all the technical
terms are the Japanese terms everyone is accustomed to. There are 100 very
nicely full page photographed tsuba, including some very nice examples.

This book site work just like Amazon, but is all in Polish. Search on
"tsuba," and you'll find the book. It is fairly easy to order. The only
tricky part is fitting US addresses into spaces designed for
Polish-formatted addresses.
